translated: The ultimate truth, the accomplished bodhisattva Maitreya, through his conduct of unimpeded activity, plays in the retinue of queens and so on, his conduct ripens beings and he himself does not become fettered.

analyzed: de bas na theg pa'i mchog 'di nyid skye bo ma lus pa bzhon par bya ba dam pa rnams yid 'phrog pa'o //

analyzed: de'i tshe don dam pa'i bden pa kho na la gnas pa'i phyir ro //

original: gzhan yang @103a * //
analyzed: gzhan yang @103a * //
translated: Moreover,

analyzed: shes pa tsam gyis 'dod chags la sogs pas mi gnod par 'gyur ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //

analyzed: rang gi brjod par bya ba nges par gzung ste /

analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa dang / dbu ma pa'i dbye bas zab pa tsam dang ldan pa'i theg pa ni rnam pa gnyis yin la /üîΩrnal 'byor spyod pa rnams kyang /

translated: The objects that exist like pieces in the external world are the appearances of the aspects of consciousness itself, appearing in the sky.

original: yang med pa'o //
analyzed: yang med pa'o //
translated: There is no object to be apprehended, such as the independent creation of God.

translated: The transformation of that mind into the pure wisdom that is free from ordinary clinging is the result, buddhahood.

translated: Those who propound that consciousness is devoid of aspects do not assert that the mind that is reflexive awareness engages in a continuous stream, but they do assert that it is momentary. They assert that the mind is free from aspects and that it is not aware of anything.

original: dag cing / rnam pa thams cad dang bral ba rang rig pa'i bdag nyid kyi bems po ma yin pa'i ye shes su gnas yongs su gyur pa 'di ni 'bras bu yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su rnam par dpyod par byed do //

translated: They assert that the mind is liberated from being the same as or different from its object. They assert that the mind is completely purified of latent tendencies. They assert that the mind is devoid of all aspects and that it is not an inanimate thing that is reflexive awareness. original: dbu ma pa kun rdzob shes pa'i rnam par smra ba rnams ni don dam pa'i rigs pa'i tshogs kyis sems dang ye shes dag yod pa ma yin par smra la /

translated: Madhyamaka Proponents of Cognition as the Ultimate say that reasonings that analyze the ultimate prove that mind and wisdom do not exist.

original: kun rdzob tu 'di ltar rnam par gzhag pa thams cad sems dang yid kyi rnam pa yul du gnas pa kho nar rtog go //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu 'di ltar rnam par gzhag pa thams cad sems dang yid kyi rnam pa yul du gnas pa kho nar rtog go //
translated: They say that all presentations conventionally are only the mind and mental factors that abide as objects.

original: de bzhin du kun rdzob bag chags su smra ba rnams kyi 'dod pa ni don dam pa'i bden pa snga ma lta bu las kun rdzob tu rnam par gzhag pa rnams ni bag chags rnams kho na yin gyi /

translated: Likewise, those who maintain that the relative is habitual propensities maintain that the ultimate is as previously explained, but that the relative is only habitual propensities.

analyzed: sems ni rnam pa dang / 'gro ba'i bdag nyid du snang ba ma yin no zhes par ro //
translated: The mind does not appear as the nature of aspects and reincarnating beings.

analyzed: 'di gnyis rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i bdag nyid 'dod pa dang / sems dang rang rig pa 'gog / rigs pa bsgrub pa ni mthun no //
translated: Both of these agree in establishing the reasoning that refutes the mind and self-awareness and maintains that they are the nature of dependent origination.

analyzed: kha cig na re 'di gnyis kyis lta ba gzhan sel ba na rim pa bzhin du /
translated: Some say that when these two refute other views, they do so in a different order.

analyzed: yod dang med dang yod med dang // yod med gnyi ga min pa ste //
translated: They say, ‚ÄúExistence, nonexistence, both existence and nonexistence, and neither existence nor nonexistence.

analyzed: zhes pa dang / rtag dang mi rtag rtag mi rtag / rtag dang mi rtag gnyi ga min //

analyzed: zhes pas go rims bzhin du mu bzhi rnam par rtog pa mi 'dra'o zhes zer ro //
translated: In this way, the four possibilities are imagined in a different order.‚Äù
